means: 使烦恼，纠缠( pester的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He's always pestering me to help him with his homework.
sentence.Network_cn: 他总是泡蘑菇要我帮他做作业.

sentence.Network_en: I thought she'd stop pestering me, but it only seemed to make her worse.
sentence.Network_cn: 我原以为她会停止纠缠我，但结果她似乎是变本加厉了。

sentence.Network_en: I'm telling you once and for all, if you don't stop pestering me you'll be sorry.
sentence.Network_cn: 我这是最后一次警告你.如果你不停止纠缠我,你将来会后悔的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: pestering him to court again ., 缠着他 , 再上法庭.
he told the photographers to stop pestering him ., 他告诉照相的人别再缠著他.
Stop pestering your little sister ., 别逗弄你的小妹妹!
He ' s always pestering me to help him with his homework ., 他总是泡蘑菇要我帮他做作业.

list.abs: they pestered us for money .他们缠住我们要钱.
when children are very young it is easy to circumvent pester power .当孩子还小的时候是很容易防止儿童消费力。
when children are very young it is easy to circumvent pester power .当孩子还小的时候是很容易防止儿童消费力。
You are a confounded nuisance ; stop pestering me ., 你这个可恶的东西 , 别再缠着我了.
he told the photographers to stop pestering him ., 他告诉照相的人别再缠著他.

entry.def: If you say that someone is pestering you, you mean that they keep asking you to do something, or keep talking to you, and you find this annoying.

example.ex: I thought she'd stop pestering me, but it only seemed to make her worse...
example.tran: 我原以为她会停止纠缠我，但结果她似乎是变本加厉了。

example.ex: I know he gets fed up with people pestering him for money.
example.tran: 我知道他烦透了那些缠着他要钱的人。

sentences.sentence: "tapping an annoying rhythm on his glass with his fork"
"aircraft noise is particularly bothersome near the airport"
"found it galling to have to ask permission"
"a teasing and persistent thought annoyed him"
"it is vexing to have to admit you are wrong"

auth_sentence.content: Pestering is what kids do; it is their function.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pestering is what kids do; it is their function.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pestering is what kids do; it is their function.

auth_sentence.content: No more pestering from M's dispossessed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No more pestering from M's dispossessed.

auth_sentence.content: Literally hundreds of men were always pestering her to marry them.
auth_sentence.res_content: Literally hundreds of men were always pestering her to marry them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Literally hundreds of men were always pestering her to marry them.

Sentence.sentence: Back in the good old days—say, two years ago, when the last of my children suffered the ordeal (折磨)—a high-school student applying to college could procrastinate all the way to New Year's Day of their senior year, assuming they could withstand the parental pestering (烦扰).
